summary: This FBI operational summary from July 2020 documents the transfer of Ghislaine Maxwell from a New Hampshire jail to the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, and announces her upcoming arraignment and bail hearing. It also references the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for child sex trafficking.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the child sex trafficking investigation (SDNY) referenced in the operational summary.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Was transferred from Merrimack County Jail to MDC Brooklyn; scheduled for arraignment and bail hearing on July 14, 2020.

connections.description: Both are central figures in the same SDNY child sex trafficking investigation, as indicated by the document's operational context.

events.title: Maxwell transferred to MDC Brooklyn
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was transferred from the Merrimack County Jail in New Hampshire to the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.

events.title: Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing
events.description: Scheduled arraignment and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell in the SDNY; courtroom closed but hearing broadcast live via video link.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody and transferred to the MDC in Brooklyn on July 6, 2020.
Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing were scheduled for July 14, 2020, in the SDNY, with the courtroom closed but the hearing broadcast via video link.
The document confirms the ongoing SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for child sex trafficking.
The document references 'OPERATION BAD HARVEST' as part of the investigative context.
National media was regularly covering Ghislaine Maxwell at the time of this report.
